label: Storage node
definition: Entity storing data for Walrus; holds one or several *shards*.

label: Blob
definition: Single unstructured data object stored on Walrus.

label: Permanent blob
definition: Blob that cannot be deleted by its owner and is guaranteed to be available until at least its expiry epoch (assuming it is valid).

label: Deletable blob
definition: Blob that can be deleted by its owner at any time to reuse the storage resource.

label: Shard
definition: (Disjoint) Subset of erasure-encoded data of all blobs; at every point in time, a shard is assigned to and stored on a single storage node.

label: RedStuff
definition: Erasure-encoding approach, which uses two different encodings (primary and secondary) to enable shard recovery; details are available in the [whitepaper](./walrus.pdf).

label: Sliver
definition: Erasure-encoded data of one shard corresponding to a single blob for one of the two encodings; this contains several erasure-encoded symbols of that blob but not the blob metadata.

label: Sliver pair
definition: The combination of a shard's primary and secondary sliver.

label: Blob ID
definition: Cryptographic ID computed from a blob's slivers.

label: Blob metadata
definition: Metadata of one blob; in particular, this contains a hash per shard to enable the authentication of slivers and recovery symbols.

label: User
definition: Any entity or person that wants to store or read blobs on or from Walrus; can act as a Walrus client itself or use the simple interface exposed by publishers and caches.

label: Publisher
definition: Service interacting with Sui and the storage nodes to store blobs on Walrus; offers a basic `HTTP POST` endpoint to end users.

label: Aggregator
definition: Service that reconstructs blobs by interacting with storage nodes and exposes a basic `HTTP GET` endpoint to end users.

label: Cache
definition: An aggregator with additional caching capabilities.

label: Client
definition: Entity interacting directly with the storage nodes; this can be an aggregator or cache, a publisher, or an end user.

label: Reconstruction
definition: Decoding of the primary slivers to obtain the blob; includes re-encoding the blob and checking the Merkle proofs.

label: Shard recovery
definition: Process of a storage node recovering a sliver or full shard by obtaining recovery symbols from other storage nodes.

label: Storage attestation
definition: Process where storage nodes exchange challenges and responses to demonstrate that they are storing their currently assigned shards.

label: Certificate of availability
definition: A blob ID with signatures of storage nodes holding at least \(2f+1\) shards in a specific epoch.

label: Point of availability
definition: Point in time when a certificate of availability is submitted to Sui and the corresponding blob is guaranteed to be available until its expiration.

label: Inconsistency proof
definition: Set of several recovery symbols with their Merkle proofs such that the decoded sliver does not match the corresponding hash; this proves an incorrect/inconsistent encoding by the client.

label: Inconsistency certificate
definition: An aggregated signature from 2/3 of storage nodes (weighted by their number of shards) that they have seen and stored an inconsistency proof for a blob ID.

label: Storage committee
definition: The set of storage nodes for a storage epoch, including metadata about the shards they are responsible for and other metadata.

label: Member
definition: A storage node that is part of a committee at some epoch.

label: Storage epoch
definition: The epoch for Walrus as distinct to the epoch for Sui.

label: Availability period
definition: The period specified in storage epochs for which a blob is certified to be available on Walrus.

label: Expiry
definition: The end epoch at which a blob is no longer available and can be deleted; the end epoch is always exclusive.

label: WAL
definition: The native token of Walrus.

label: FROST
definition: The smallest unit of WAL (similar to MIST for SUI); 1 WAL is equal to 1 billion (1000000000) FROST.
